intro: Dontospermum, commonly known as the "sea hibiscus," is a genus of flowering plants in the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its succulent, often hairy leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and are adapted to saline and sandy soils. They produce capsule fruits that contain numerous small, hard seeds. Dontospermum species are often used in traditional medicine and are valued for their ornamental appeal.
